item.description: ЁЯМПрдХреНрд╖реЗрддреНрд░рдореН (рд╕рд╣рдХрд╛рд░-рдирдЧрд░рдореН, рдХрд▓реНрдпрд╛рдгрдкреБрд░реА) Basic parameters lunar_month_assigner_type = "MULTI_NEW_MOON_SIDEREAL_MONTH_ADHIKA" ayanaamsha_id = "CHITRA_AT_180" jsonClass = "ComputationSystem" Event options aparaahna_as_second_half = false prefer_eight_fold_day_division = false julian_handling = "converted to Gregorian" jsonClass = "FestivalOptions" Repos: devatA/gaNapati, devatA/graha, devatA/kaumAra, devatA/lakShmI, devatA/misc-fauna, devatA/misc-flora, devatA/nadI, devatA/pitR, devatA/shaiva, devatA/shakti, devatA/umA, devatA/vaiShNava, gRhya/Apastamba, gRhya/general, general, mahApuruSha/ALvAr, mahApuruSha/RShi, mahApuruSha/general, mahApuruSha/kAnchI-maTha, mahApuruSha/mAdhva-misc, mahApuruSha/nAyanAr, mahApuruSha/sangIta-kRt, mahApuruSha/smArta-misc, mahApuruSha/vaiShNava-misc, mahApuruSha/xatra, mahApuruSha/xatra-later, tamil, temples/Andhra, temples/Kerala, temples/North, temples/Odisha, temples/Tamil, temples/venkaTAchala, time_focus/Eclipses, time_focus/amrita-siddhi, time_focus/Rtu, time_focus/misc, time_focus/misc_combinations, time_focus/special-tithis, time_focus/tithi-vara-combinations, time_focus/monthly/amAvAsyA, time_focus/monthly/dvAdashI, time_focus/monthly/ekAdashI, time_focus/monthly/pradoSha, time_focus/nakShatra, time_focus/puShkara, time_focus/sankrAnti, time_focus/yugAdiH

item.title: Computation parameters
item.description: ЁЯМПрдХреНрд╖реЗрддреНрд░рдореН (рд╕рд╣рдХрд╛рд░-рдирдЧрд░рдореН, рдХрд▓реНрдпрд╛рдгрдкреБрд░реА) Basic parameters lunar_month_assigner_type = "SOLSTICE_POST_DARK_10_ADHIKA" ayanaamsha_id = "CHITRA_AT_180" jsonClass = "ComputationSystem" Event options aparaahna_as_second_half = true prefer_eight_fold_day_division = true julian_handling = "converted to Gregorian" jsonClass = "FestivalOptions" Repos: gRhya/general

item.title: Contributing
item.description: Contributions welcome! Please see some basic comments (pertaining to the time format used internally, API layers required) in the base jyotisha package though. Testing and autotesting Every push to this repository SHOULD pass tests. We should have a rich, functional set of tests at various levels. Saves everyone’s time. You can see the status of failing tests and builds at https://github.com/sanskrit-coders/jyotisha/actions . PS: You can probably subscribe to get email notification on failed workflow runs as well - I’m getting these.

item.title: For users
item.description: For detailed examples and help, please see individual module files - especially test files in this package. Installation or upgrade: Install the pyswisseph library specially as described below. Install the jyotisha package (Prefer this to get the latest code:)sudo pip install git+https://github.com/sanskrit-coders/jyotisha/@master -U sudo pip install jyotisha -U Web. Usage Simple invocation The simplest way to invoke the code and generate calendars in a variety of forms (icalendar/ ics, tex [which can then be converted to pdf], markdown [which can then be presented as html]) is to use python invocations of the type seen in: tests such as those in jyotisha_tests/spatio_temporal/writer Calendar generation projects such as those under jyotisha/panchaanga/writer/generation_project Command line usage - can be invoked via some shell scripts at karthik’s panchaanga repo.
